news_header: Two beaches in Sydney were closed due to mysterious black balls found on the shore.
news_text: Coogee Beach and Gordons Bay Beach in Sydney, Australia, were closed after local authorities discovered mysterious black, ball-shaped debris along the shores. Initial tests indicated that the material might be hydrocarbon-based pollutants, possibly 'tar balls' resulting from oil spills. The New South Wales Environment Protection Authority was notified, and the Randwick city council is collaborating with them to establish a clean-up and disposal plan.
